snippet: Adding 50 cancers to the list of illnesses covered by a health fund was the right thing to do because we have an obligation to help those harmed by exposure at ground zero.
abstract: Editorial expresses support for the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health's proposal to add 50 cancers to the list of illnesses covered by a $4.3 billion fund to treat and compensate emergency workers and residents exposed to toxic substances after the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: Adding 50 cancers to the list of illnesses covered by a health fund was the right thing to do because we have an obligation to help those harmed by exposure at ground zero.

keywords.value: James Zadroga 9-11 Health and Compensation Act
keywords.name: subject
